FpZmW5rwjSm11x31t2w6Mg.text: This place has a great atmosphere, great employees, and amazing dishes! The food is really delicious! I got the Fusilli Con Pollo E Pesto and was not disappointed. We were all delighted with our meals. For dessert, we had Sticky Toffee Pudding. It was a great way to wrap up our meal. Yum! Our waitress, Klara, was very friendly and used a lot of initiative. She was enthusiastic and on top of things. When we left upon finishing dinner, my brother left his umbrella and she ran out to return it to us! We are very pleased with our experience. Highly recommend this place!

oWPF0bIKOsZNd41QfBhICA.text: Just WOW! My wife and I shared the 2 items-pasta/pizza combo. We had the bolognese pasta and tricolore pizza. We were dubious about rosemary potato on pizza but it was very good! It came out from the kitchen very quickly! Had an Italian Rosso wine called Biferno that was great for the price! We shared the lemon sponge cake with raspberries. It was a great finish!  We were full up on Cullen Skink and fish and chips. Needed a break and found a great spot that we may visit again before we leave Edinburgh! A note about the waitstaff: Sonia was our server. She was charming and patient and made good suggestions! She's a gem! Outstanding experience all around!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delisia lemonari ( or something like that )

OccDtM5zUErh8A2ru2SU-Q.text: There are so many amazing Italian eateries all over the world, in Italy, in America, sometimes in the most unlikely of places. But, for every fabulous restaurant there must exist an opposite, a really horrendous restaurant somewhere to counterbalance each great restaurant. Therefore, I suppose there exists an absolute worst Italian restaurant somewhere in the world. And I think I just found it in Scotland!  The sleek, modern interior draws in tourist after unsuspecting tourist, thinking they're entering a fine Italian establishment. Take advice from an accomplished cook who grew up in a family of chefs. This is really bad Italian food!  Our family always starts with calamari, and what we ate was unequivocally the worst calamari we have ever tasted anywhere in the world. Yup, 79 countries visited, thousands of restaurants visited, and this is THE WORST appetizer in my life! The calamari was chewy, meaning it wasn't prepared properly, the batter was horrid, and it was obviously overcooked. Absolutely inedible!  Next I attempted to survive a burrito-shaped chicken stuffed with cheese and wrapped in ham. Horrible! Quite possibly the worst chicken dish I've ever tasted. The chicken was dry, the cheese tasted like some sort of processed liquid cheese oozing out of the inside, and the ham was as tough as plastic! Yikes!!!  My wife had pasta, but it was so oddly lumpy and undercooked that it was essentially inedible. The waiter asked why she hadn't eaten her meal and she explained. He turned and walked away completely unconcerned.  My son had spaghetti and meatballs, his favorite dish. He's a big eater, so he always cleans his plate, especially this particular dish. He got halfway through it before losing the battle, stating he could no longer eat this food!  I attempted to eat a side dish called potato gratin. It consisted of lukewarm potatoes mixed with what I think was milk and utterly tasteless cheese. It was even worse than the ham-wrapped chicken burrito-looking thingy. Yuck!!! It's still churning in my stomach as I write this review! Horrendous!!! We heard several other tables complaining about the quality as well, so our family sentiment was definitely a theme.  Do not eat here, whatever you do!!! You've been warned!

2GfSyZIz1YCMyT5brkp67A.text: Looks good from the sidewalk and they talk a good game. Food was incredibly average, maybe less than average. The service was worse.   You know the service was bad when the server apologizes for the bad service when he hands you the bill and the manager says Sorry as you walk out the door instead of good night.   If you want authentic Italian keep walking or hold your cravings til the next day.

t2GMrmEpq67WVeW6mdoPJQ.text: Loved this place. The staff was friendly, the food was delicious, and the decor was smart and modern. Would definitely visit again.

05mrEYpURPpsi6M0DBK-Nw.text: 3.5 stars really. A good Italian spot close to the Royal Mile. It has a large capacity, so that may be a reason why it wasn't hard for us to get a seat on a Friday night (although it was busy). The place was nice (a bit bright, maybe), service was good, and we enjoyed the food. We had the tagliatelle bolognese, tagliatelle Vittoria, the 1/2 and 1/2, with Margherita pizza and gnocchi, and fiocchi pasta with cheese and pear. Just a few dings - the focaccia appetizer tasted great, but it was flat, like pizza crust thickness, instead of what is typical. Just a little strange. Also, some of the drinks and dishes were not served together, so some had to wait a bit, although not so long that we wondered what happened. For dessert we had a tiramisu, profiteroles, and ice cream. All just ok I would say. 3.5 stars if I could, but we had a good time, and it was a solid place, so the bump up to 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pizza and gnocchi
Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pizza and gnocchi
Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

2DU98eWLitX4Bev8lRNbTg.text: Very nice ambiance, very fancy. We ordered lasagna, calzon pizza, fish and chips and waffle dessert. Lasagna was the best amongst all. Fish and chips were good not crispy, calzon was not upto the mark and dessert was low in quantity.

photos.caption: Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Calzon
Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

cel8Ytz1CZLa17gA1hV6yQ.text: The bolognese pasta was great. Nice atmosphere and great service.

NEuUXN650ftaWpom7GLWIw.text: We ate here this summer as part of a large group on a Saturday night. They were slammed. It was chaotic and the food wasn't very good.  Our servers seemed annoyed the whole time that we were a large group. We pre-ordered our meal choices, and they acted really annoyed when there was a misunderstanding with my pre-order.  I wouldn't recommend it or return.

CS47L-eE-_wCUfBrvMazCg.text: Excellent food! We ordered the mushroom pizza and spinach/ricotta and mushroom ravioli and both were delicious.  The pizza reminds me of pizza I've  had in Rome. If we weren't leaving in the morning I would definitely come back! Service was great too and the food came out quickly even though they were quite busy!

2qc83RljexDajlxuwn7Z-w.text: Great option for Italian near the Old Town.  We did dinner for 6 (2 adults and 4 kids) for 95 GBP including 3 alcoholic beverages, an appetizer for the adults, the "3 course meal" for each of the kids, and 2 mains with 2 desserts for the adults.  It felt like a ton of food for what we paid.  I loved the tagliatelle bolognese- pasta was perfectly cooked and the sauce was extremely flavorful.  The kids menu is super fun- they offer a 3 course meal for the kids allowing them to choose 1 starter, 1 main, and 1 dessert.  The kids loved it.  We will definitely return the next time we are in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

bHZ0GsK0zoRjzsR8xMsXWQ.text: Just finished eating here with my wee person and boy toy. We ordered spaghetti and meatballs, garlic mozzarella bread, spinach (creamed?), battered haddoc and chips and minestrone soup.  Every entree and side was delectable.  The pasta was perfect - not too soft or hard.  And to top it all off the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. I wish we had found this place earlier during our Edinburgh stay.  Grazie!

G4RWJOeg6oQrwuvVGh2_Sw.text: Not impressed. Hubs and I went here after reading good reviews on Yelp and Trip Advisor. Our garlic toast was tasty and we ate it up. Hubs' pasta with bolognese was decent and he ate it all. My chicken wrapped in Parma ham not so much....dried out. Zuke frites were cold and sent back only to return without the dipping sauce. What once may have been a quality food stop has got a little too big for its own good. Server was fab though.

b5O4RBcMROLc1TYyx7HG1w.text: I was really excited to come here - first time having Italian food in the UK! My friend and I walked in and asked for a table for 2. The guy said we could sit at the bar but there are no tables...so we politely declined and said we will find another place. Then another guy comes out and suggested that we could sit outside. Fine. It was a nice day.  I had their spin on carbonara (cream, mushroom, pancetta). It was COVERED in black pepper. Like they just dumped it in. I was very surprised...The pasta was just ok. Usually chefs over salt/pepper to compensate with lack of flavor. It was very simple, something I could have easily made at home (minus all the unnecessary black pepper).  My friend got the special (lobster ravioli). She said it seemed like there was no lobster at all. We took a closer look and there really wasn't! Just white cheese...  Dinner was over and they gave us a dessert menu. We passed and they looked disappointed?? It was odd.  I got weird vibes from the staff here. It was pretty uncomfortable and I certainly would not recommend this place for top-quality Italian food.  Disclaimer: *I'm a New Yorker, so I'm used to amazing Italian food*

photos.caption: Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Spin on carbonara. Aka cream, pancetta, mushroom. Wayyyy too much pepper

8_gv16JZNAZSfj_D9rvBVg.text: My husband got a half order of chicken and mushroom pizza and a half order of the original carbonara and really liked his. I ordered their "most popular" pasta with mushrooms and spicy sausage. It barely had any mushrooms and the sausage was way too spicy for either of us to eat. I do have to say this was our most substantial meal in Edinburgh. The wine and beer were great, and our service was great. For dessert, we ordered Tony's Banana boat. It was awesome and made up for the spicy pasta. The restaurant was very nice inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tagliatelle spicy sausage and mushroom pasta
Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tony&#39;s banana boat

aVUmzADC2zRwvxrxBmYdsg.text: Delightful Italian getaway right off the Royal Mile in Edinburgh!  Every single thing we ordered was delicious, and our server was amazing!  Beautiful Italian spot and would absolutely visit again!  (The only photo I managed to grab was the Banoffee Pie, which changed me as a person. YUM!)

photos.caption: Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

AtkWdKi8C3JxCNQPzUSHMw.text: OK but not great spaghetti carbonara.Vegetarian spouse had ravioli & she rated it 4 stars but she thinks everything is delicious. Also had mac&cheese croquettes & minestrone soup & both were very good. Wines by the glass were overpriced. Complementary bread and olive oil would have been nice touch for app & entree pricing. Service was superlative.

nuoOUiOHJkiUiwWfBioDlQ.text: We were in here in December 2017 and my son (age 11), can't stop talking about this. Great food and atmosphere. A little noisy (aka lively).  Such a fun place. I highly recommend.

iT7mv8wHZTB6zg9S-_IWNA.text: Excellent high quality food, service, and atmosphere. Came here on whim, was passing through definitely had one of the best meals here in Edinburgh. They have a 8 main lunch deal which is a steal and the staff is very tentative and friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Minestrone soup
Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

8_aveBtOPRtEdZXUJiRykQ.text: Some of the best Italian food in town! I never thought I'd be eating authentic Italian food in Scotland!  We arrived for a late dinner and the restaurant was pretty empty. Our waiter Nicola was very nice and made some great recommendations.   My favorite thing about this restaurant is that they have a meta-meta option, which means you can pick a pasta and pizza and get half of each! Best of both worlds. I ordered the original pasta carbonara and parmigiana pizza. The pasta was classic! The pizza was one of the best I have ever had! Everything was made fresh to order.   Drinks: the bellini and Edinburgh bramble were fantastic.   Would definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vittoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Meta meta - half portion of pasta carbonara and half portion of parmigiana pizza

yA0VVJ6F_ecH4-48GDyC1g.text: We were out of town to see the Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo and looking for a nearby restaurant for dinner. The first couple of restaurants were full. Not only could Vittoria could accommodate our group, but the the service was amazing! Even better, the food was over the top good - I wish this restaurant was in my town!!

l01sI2ItoIZ0IqElqGo8kQ.text: Food was great, but staff run about brushing past you every few seconds. Too many tables, staff need to be slightly less stressful.

0DlIkh9r60pr9TBhDB55yw.text: I went here on a recent trip to Edinburgh for dinner and really enjoyed it. We turned up on the night without a booking but the staff managed to quickly find us a table even though it was busy. The restaurant was smart & modern and the service was quick and friendly. The food was a very reasonable price and I had the spicy sea food tagliatelle which was very flavoursome and came with a large variety of seafood & shell fish. I left very happy.

rCqN6JC5KPS-hZdaOCrgVA.text: Excellent service and food, would highly recommend, slightly better wine menu would be better, but all I all very good experience

mjJrdkDD6fAutOLXabR-UQ.text: This is the second Vittoria restaurant to open in Edinburgh and has become an instant hit. The unit it occupies has had a few occupants in recent years but Vittoria's is here to stay. The food is very good value and tasty - great, authentic Italian food from a friendly family business. The lunch menu is especially good value with small pasta dishes at around 5-6 and filled rolls (usually ciabattas) for 4-5, all of them tasty with interesting and delicious combinations of fillings. The staff are very accommodating and there is so much space that it is always possible to get a table for two if not more, although for larger groups it is advisable to book. The service is quick and the staff friendly and eager to please. There is a takeaway counter serving ice cream and other desserts to passers-by, however I've not had the chance to sample its delights as yet. The atmosphere is typical of an Italian restaurant - noisy, relaxed and informal. Excellent all round.

DnYLbSiRScbPPAqZyei5kQ.text: Very busy which is good sign. Very good range of food on menu. Loved the idea of spilting your order so you could have half pizza half pasta. Food was nice, Service was good.

kY1addwxDYTIWaY3ByuPJA.text: One of our favorite restaurants in Edinburgh. Good prices, lively and friendly service. It is always busy here (we normally go to the Leith Walk Branch).   The food is what you would expect from an italian restaurant - all the old favorites. Generous portions and great range of ice cream for pudding.   Definitely worth a visit.

jzN7-eh5wbnditHo4M0OIw.text: Fantastic. We visited Edinburgh and fancied an italian meal so searched a few on the internet and found Vittoria. What a place!   The food was excellent, service fantastic and friendly staff.   The restaurant is quite modern, very clean and has a separate dining area downstairs too for functions etc.   All-in-all we had an excellent meal and will return when next in Edinburgh.

XSFc-7zufH3d9a1v_5lqCg.text: Nice friendly, family run italian which is situated close to the city centre of Edinburgh. There are several good bars on the same street if you fancy a quick one before eating.   The decor is clean and modern and the place has a nice atmosphere. Beware when there is a hen night on as things get a little noisy and banana puddings arrive, with sparklers shaped in a particular naughty way!!   The restaurant is big - at first you think that it is full when you enter but there is a whole floor downstairs too which is the main place they put the hen parties.   Friendly staff, nice surroundings, varied menu, good food, big portions. Definitely worth a visit.

RWp0zGPqluvxPr5noNYtLQ.text: I was very impressed that Vittoria amnaged to sit our party of 17 with no problem, no slow service and no errors! Really friendly waiters, very attentive. As a large party we were asked to order in advance and this seemed to help. I had king prawns for starter and a tuna steak for mains, if I was to gripe about anything I perhaps would not have had my tuna steak so well done, however, given that they fed so many of us so fast, it is a small thing. Bill split 17 ways was about 30 each (about 2 drinks each). Good place to go if you have a big group, as they are able and willing!

05W8lW6U_Tl5hegJ3Bbxsw.text: We had our staff Xmas dinner here; it's the first time I'd eaten in this branch - loved the Leith Walk original and La Favorita. The standards are just as high, the service is excellent and the food can't be faulted - the rich flavours and fresh ingredients are exactly what you hope for in Italian food. It's a hustling-bustling fun place to be.

_yJAWzgYUyOWB0LtgY5OlA.text: It's been a while since I last stepped into Vittoria, but it was a memorable enough experience to review offhand!  The surroundings are spacious and modern, but with a cosy, rustic colour scheme that looks great when the sun goes down. Perfect for a wee candlelight romantic meal.   Which is what me and my boyfriend went for and it was amazing! Lovely A La Carte menu, with traditional, thick Italian pizzas that are explained in a fun way on the menu. The extensive amount of food they do in here shows the sheer dedication by the chef's - just look for yourself on the website. But they offer a ton of veggie options, at least 10 different kinds of pizzas (from plain to adventurous) and a great wine list. I went for red wine when I was in here last by the server's recommendation, and although I'm not usually a fan of the red stuff the descriptive menu and our helpful waiter both aided me in making a good choice. Everything was delicious. I went for a spicy option, aptly named Vesuvio, which is hotter than Iceland's volcano chaos right now but still gorgeous. Eating a spicy pizza just made me drink more wine, which isn't a bad thing when you are having a night being pampered. My boyfriend's pizza was gone in 60 seconds.  The whole experience was amazing, with lovely surroundings, attentive staff and food that was lovingly created. Vittoria has been raking in awards since the 70s and after a number of successful visits now, it's easy to see why. Pizza magic!

hlBhEV7U7F-XmnzKyVs2-w.text: The pizza funghi was spectacular.  True Italian fare same as in Italy.  Great atmosphere, intimate, bustling, modern.  The staff was great.  We stuffed ourselves silly and would do it again!  Do yourself a favor though -- make a reservation.  They are always packed.

YKp-g6C1OrVkw0NEgEzxqw.text: That a lovely italiam restaurant. The price are really reasonable and the service is very friendly. The dishs and desserts are very good. You also can take a dessert in take away. I advice you to taste the chocolate cake which is delicious! Don t hesitate to eat at this restaurant!

RAIOnCxAwRh5Jakhm504zQ.text: Awesome service, the Tuscan bean salad, brusecetta, spaghetti with meatballs, and Lasagna Verde, Tiramisu , ice cream all were amazing, my wife and I loved it.

mhHIdritGc8DypAKMtRnvA.text: Love this place - it's a fairly standard Italian menu but the ingredients are particularly high quality and everything is finished with care. The waiters are highly entertaining too.

1ie-Lw2T6QR-DHodCG30gA.text: Nice Modern Decor Excellent atmosphere & Fantastic food. Friendly & helpful staff. Prices fairly reasonable

4KsE4OEpeO3xSj27wbxnag.text: Very family friendly Italian restaurant. The food here is lovely. They do a very reasonably priced lunch menu too. The atmosphere is very good, and service good also, for such a busy city centre location. The restaurant is surprisingly big too, with a whole other level tucked away downstairs. Great for a staff night out, I'd think.

Kea1pgS2Vh0iFs1fdwKgMg.text: Nice restaurant, very good pasta and very...very quick service. Strongly recommend if you want to eat good pasta and pizza. The only negative point is that we expected the plates to be bigger. Nice desert, we had "trio of deserts, mmmm......delicious.

MKPjzTTxdzpBgX-Hevs_Uw.text: I love Vittoria's in leith and was really excited when they opened the new restaurant on George 1V bridge. It's got a different feel to the Leith restaurant, quite trendy and a bit more up market but the same values are there. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and the food is amazing! There is a huge selection of starters, breads, pizza and pasta. There are old classics like lasagne and macaroni but there are some exciting specials on offer like pasta stuffed with aubergine. yum! desserts are also impressive but I recommend choosing a few different flavours of ice cream as they are all delicious (gingerbread ice cream is awesome, as is pistachio and nougat) This is a great restaurant, and I've eaten here on loads of different occasions. Its really nice for a romantic quiet meal but also great for a big group party. The waiters are accomodating of either situation and in the party situation really go out of their way to make sure everyone has a good night.  It's reasonably priced, the food is amazing and the atmosphere is great too. I love Vittorias!

reqLHbQoQdOe1ItYKWc6HA.text: A family run Italian restaurant with some of the friendliest staff I've ever met this restaurant has a great atmosphere and very reasonable prices for fantastic food and a large, varied menu. La Favourita further along Leith Walk is a pizza restaurant owned by the same family.

yl7pcRMZpH75C3FrW1Zdyw.text: The best italian in Edinburgh. Visit and you will not be disappointed. A nice atmosphere with good service and a range of food. Pizzas to pasta to seafood are all brilliant and it is possible to do half and half providing someone else asks for the other half. Well priced and all food is very tasty. Good location with lots of nearby bars. Easily accessible on the 23 or 27 bus.

OQOc-hPk2ZsNkNIVXj_c1A.text: Everyone who has reviewed this wonderful place seems to be agreed - it is something special. Over the years I have been for a snack, done lunch, had an evening blow out, had office parties and never once was the food and service anything less than fantastic. Their version of Chicken Milanese - Pollo Padana if memory serves - is my absolute favourite and a delightful meal. The fried onions that accompany it are probably the best I've ever had. If you doubt how 'Italian' it is just look for the tables full of Italian families munching happily through plates of patate (chips to you and me). Love this place to bits.

512tPrHTsrjdteDfTxYJQA.text: Amazing Lasagna, buit the girl who served us made us feel unwelcome, its a huge restaurant, good value, very family orientated.

X8DkQxoOuUgkz5tFVtEMkA.text: Nice food, service OK, prices reasonable.
